rtega_mnemonic:
瘦瘦RS
痩痩		thin, emaciated, lean, meager
  • old 叟/叟 sick 疒 person: thin and meager
heisig_constituent: lose weight, sickness, hospital, Buddha’s hand, monkey, sun, day, stick, crotch
koohiiStory1: The most horrific way to lose weight is from that devastating sickness that came from a monkey's crotch.
koohiiStory2: The poor monkey obviously had a sickness. He was scratching his crotch the whole time and when he started to lose weight heavily, the caretakers knew they couldn´t save him anymore.
onYomi: ソウ、チュウ、シュウ、シュ
jp_example_words: 痩せる(やせる): lose weight
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You are so sick that you've come to look like the humble stool: thin. Eerily thin, in fact.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine standing behind a stool and being able to disappear behind it completely. That's how thin this sickness has made you.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: When you're this thin, your soul (そう) is visible from outside of your body too.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture your soul pulsing through your thin body. You have no body fat to cover it up, so everyone can see it pulsing and lurking in there. This is why you're hiding behind one of the humble stools in your house.
Ru_Notes: Радикал "болезнь" (疒): кандзи, содержащие компонент 疒, почти все связаны с болезнями.
Ru_trainchinese: shòu: (прил) худой (устар., сейчас используется 瘦)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: you say (申) again (又) that it's an illness (疒) to get (too) thin

痩せる(やせる): lose weight

痩字的基本解释

痩
shòu
古同“瘦”。

痩字的汉语字典释义

[①]［shòu］
［《廣韻》所祐切，去宥，生。］
亦作“痩1”。亦作“膄1”。
(1)肌肉不丰满；脂肪少。
(2)细小；不茁壮。
(3)消损；减少。
(4)（土地）瘠薄，不肥沃。
(5)形容削直、突兀。
(6)贫困；不富裕。
(7)窄小，不宽大。
(8)中医指脉象沉细。
(9)谓字体细而有力。参见“瘦硬”。
(10)比喻诗歌简啬孤峭。

痩字的康熙字典解释
痩字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
痩字的起名意思

暂无。

痩
Basic explanation of words
痩
shòu
Gu Tong is "thin".
痩
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［shòu］
["Guangyun" cut, go to you, and give birth. ]
Also known as "痩1". Also known as "fat 1".
(1) The muscles are not full; the fat is low.
(2) Small; not strong.
(3) Loss; reduction.
(4) (The land) is barren and not fertile.
(5) Describe straight and abrupt.
(6) Poverty; not rich.
(7) Narrow and small, not wide.
(8) Traditional Chinese medicine means that the pulse condition is very thin.
(9) The font is thin and powerful. See "Skinny".
(10) Simple and solitary metaphor poetry.

痩
Name meaning

shòu
яп. вм. 瘦
Radicals: 疒, 申, 又  (sick, humble, stool)
Meaning Mnemonic
You are so sick that you've come to look like the humble stool: thin. Eerily thin, in fact.
Imagine standing behind a stool and being able to disappear behind it completely. That's how thin this sickness has made you.
Reading Mnemonic
When you're this thin, your soul (そう) is visible from outside of your body too.
Picture your soul pulsing through your thin body. You have no body fat to cover it up, so everyone can see it pulsing and lurking in there. This is why you're hiding behind one of the humble stools in your house.

Examples: 痩せる (や.せる)
又 (опять), 疔 (фурункул)
Радикал "болезнь" (疒): кандзи, содержащие компонент 疒, почти все связаны с болезнями.
